title: Enhanced CLI profile display
description:
## Goal
Update CLI output to display all new profile information with error details.

## Dependencies
- Depends on: bridle-jm3 (Wire up extraction)

## Changes

Update src/cli/profile.rs show_profile() output:

```
Profile: my-profile
Harness: OpenCode
Status: Active
Path: /Users/me/.config/opencode/profiles/my-profile

Theme: catppuccin
Model: claude-sonnet-4

MCP Servers (3):
  ✓ filesystem
  ✓ github  
  ✗ postgres (disabled)

Skills (5):
  code-review, testing, refactor, docs, security

Commands (3):
  /commit, /review, /deploy

Plugins (2):
  lsp-helper, git-tools

Agents (1):
  custom-agent

Rules: AGENTS.md

Errors:
  ⚠ Theme: Failed to parse opencode.jsonc - invalid JSON
```

## Display Rules
- Theme: Show value or "(not supported)" for Claude/Goose
- Model: Show value or omit if not configured
- MCP Servers: ✓ for enabled, ✗ for disabled, show count in header
- Resources (Skills/Commands/Plugins/Agents): Show count + comma-separated list
- Plugins/Agents: Show "(not supported)" for Claude/Goose
- Rules: Show filename if present, omit section if no rules
- Errors: Only show section if extraction_errors is non-empty, use ⚠ prefix

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All new fields displayed in CLI output
- [ ] Enabled/disabled indicators for MCP servers
- [ ] "(not supported)" shown for harness-specific features
- [ ] Errors section shows extraction failures
- [ ] Clean formatting, consistent with existing CLI style
- [ ] cargo clippy passes

title: Auto-save active profile before switching
description:
When switching profiles, bridle should save the current live config back to the active profile BEFORE copying the new profile over.

**Current behavior:** switch_profile() only copies profile → live config, losing any edits made to the live config.

**Expected behavior:** 
1. Check if there's an active profile for this harness
2. If yes, copy live config → active profile (save changes)
3. Then copy new profile → live config

**Reproduction:**
1. Switch to Profile A
2. Edit the harness config externally (add MCP server, change setting)
3. Switch to Profile B
4. Switch back to Profile A
5. Edits from step 2 are gone

**Fix location:** ProfileManager::switch_profile() in src/config/manager.rs

Profile Switching - atomic switch with backup
description:
## Context
Implements atomic profile switching with backup-before-apply. Most critical phase for data safety.

## Key Changes
- `src/config/manager.rs` - Add backups_dir(), create_backup(), switch_profile()
- `src/cli/profile.rs` - Implement switch_profile() handler
- `Cargo.toml` - Add chrono = "0.4" for timestamp formatting

## Algorithm (switch_profile)
1. Validate profile exists
2. Backup current config to backups/<harness>/<timestamp>/
3. Create staging dir in same parent as target
4. Copy profile -> staging
5. Remove target, rename staging -> target
6. Update BridleConfig.active, save

## Patterns to Follow
- Backup naming: YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SS format
- Staging dir: .bridle-staging-<pid>-<timestamp>
- Always backup before any destructive operation

## Success Criteria
- [ ] cargo build && cargo clippy -- -D warnings
- [ ] bridle profile switch claude-code work creates backup
- [ ] Backup appears in ~/.config/bridle/backups/claude-code/
- [ ] Active profile updated in config.toml
- [ ] bridle status shows new active profile

## References
- Full plan: .beads/artifacts/bridle-zo9/plan.md (Phase 3 section)
- Research: .beads/artifacts/bridle-zo9/research.md

title: TUI expandable profile detail view
description:
## Goal
Implement inline expansion for selected profile in the TUI profile list, showing full details.

## Dependencies
- Depends on: bridle-jm3 (Wire up extraction)

## Design
Expandable detail view - selected profile expands inline:

```
┌──────────────┬──────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  Harnesses   │              Profiles                        │
│    (25%)     │               (75%)                          │
├──────────────┼──────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ ► Claude     │ ● my-profile ────────────────────────────    │
│   OpenCode   │   │ Theme: catppuccin  Model: claude-sonnet  │
│   Goose      │   │ MCP: ✓filesystem ✓github ✗postgres       │
│              │   │ Skills: 5  Commands: 3  Plugins: 2       │
│              │   │ Rules: AGENTS.md                         │
│              │   │ ⚠ Error: Failed to parse config          │
│              │   └──────────────────────────────────────    │
│              │   work-profile (3 MCP)                       │
│              │   minimal (1 MCP)                            │
└──────────────┴──────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Changes to src/tui/mod.rs

### State Changes
```rust
struct App {
    // ... existing fields
    expanded_profile: Option<usize>,  // Index of expanded profile, if any
}
```

### New Rendering Functions
```rust
/// Render compact single-line profile view
fn render_profile_compact(profile: &ProfileInfo) -> Line {
    // Format: "● name (N MCP)" or "  name (N MCP)"
}

/// Render expanded multi-line profile view
fn render_profile_expanded(profile: &ProfileInfo) -> Vec<Line> {
    // Line 1: Name + active marker + separator line
    // Line 2: Theme + Model (show "(not supported)" where applicable)
    // Line 3: MCP servers with ✓/✗ indicators
    // Line 4: Resource counts (Skills, Commands, Plugins, Agents)
    // Line 5: Rules file if present
    // Line 6+: Errors if any (in yellow/red)
    // Final: closing separator line
}
```

### Update render_profiles()
- Check if profile index matches expanded_profile
- Use render_profile_expanded() for expanded, render_profile_compact() for others
- Handle variable height items in scroll calculations

### Key Bindings
- Space or Enter on profile: Toggle expansion
- If already expanded, collapse; if collapsed, expand
- Only one profile expanded at a time

### Visual Styling
- Use colors: Green for enabled MCP, Red for disabled
- Yellow/Red for error messages
- Box-drawing characters for expanded view borders
- Active profile marker: ● (green if possible)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Selected profile expands to show full details inline
- [ ] Unselected profiles show compact single-line view
- [ ] Space/Enter toggles expansion
- [ ] Only one profile expanded at a time
- [ ] MCP servers show ✓/✗ with colors
- [ ] "(not supported)" shown for harness-specific features
- [ ] Errors displayed in expanded view
- [ ] Scrolling works correctly with variable height items
- [ ] cargo clippy passes

title: Enhanced ProfileInfo data structures
description:
## Goal
Extend ProfileInfo struct with extensible types for all new profile information.

## Changes

Add new types in src/config/ or src/harness/:

```rust
/// Extensible MCP server info - start with name+enabled, easy to add fields later
pub struct McpServerInfo {
    pub name: String,
    pub enabled: bool,
    // Future: pub transport: McpTransport, pub command: Option<String>, etc.
}

/// Resource summary for directory-based items (skills, commands, etc.)
pub struct ResourceSummary {
    pub items: Vec<String>,
    pub directory_exists: bool,
}
```

Update ProfileInfo in src/config/manager.rs:

```rust
pub struct ProfileInfo {
    // Existing
    pub name: String,
    pub harness_id: String,
    pub is_active: bool,
    pub path: PathBuf,
    
    // New - replaces Vec<String>
    pub mcp_servers: Vec<McpServerInfo>,
    pub skills: ResourceSummary,
    pub commands: ResourceSummary,
    pub plugins: Option<ResourceSummary>,  // OpenCode only
    pub agents: Option<ResourceSummary>,   // OpenCode only
    pub rules_file: Option<PathBuf>,
    pub theme: Option<String>,             // OpenCode only
    pub model: Option<String>,
    
    // Error tracking
    pub extraction_errors: Vec<String>,    // Show what failed to parse
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] McpServerInfo struct created with name + enabled fields
- [ ] ResourceSummary struct created with items + directory_exists
- [ ] ProfileInfo extended with all new fields
- [ ] Existing code compiles (may need temporary Default implementations)
- [ ] cargo clippy passes
